name: Mercury
description: Mercury is the closest planet to the Sun and the smallest in the Solar System. It has a rocky, cratered surface much like the Moon. With virtually no atmosphere to retain heat, temperatures swing drastically between day and night.

name: Venus
description: Venus is similar in size and structure to Earth but covered with thick clouds of sulfuric acid. Its surface is rocky and volcanic, with extreme temperatures caused by a runaway greenhouse effect, making it the hottest planet.

name: Earth

moonObject.name: Moon
moonObject.description: The Moon is Earth's only natural satellite. It has a rocky surface covered with craters and flat plains. It influences Earth's tides and has a synchronous rotation, meaning the same side always faces Earth. It has no atmosphere, leading to extreme temperature variations.

description: Earth is the only planet known to support life, with liquid water covering over 70% of its surface. It has a breathable atmosphere and a protective magnetic field. Its surface includes mountains, oceans, forests, and deserts.

name: Mars

moonObject.name: Phobos
moonObject.description: Phobos is the larger and closer of Mars' two moons. It is irregularly shaped and heavily cratered. Phobos orbits Mars very quickly, completing one orbit in about 7.6 hours. It is slowly spiraling inward and may eventually break apart or crash into Mars.

moonObject.name: Deimos
moonObject.description: Deimos is the smaller and more distant of Mars' two moons. It has a smoother and less cratered surface compared to Phobos. Deimos orbits Mars in about 30.3 hours and is thought to be a captured asteroid.

description: Mars is a cold desert world with the largest volcano and canyon in the Solar System. It has polar ice caps and signs of past water activity. Its thin atmosphere is mostly carbon dioxide, and it may have underground water today.

name: Jupiter
description: Jupiter is the largest planet in the Solar System and a gas giant with a thick atmosphere of hydrogen and helium. Its most famous feature is the Great Red Spot—a massive storm system. It has at least 79 moons, including Ganymede, the largest moon in the Solar System.

name: Saturn
description: Saturn is best known for its spectacular ring system, made of ice and rock particles. It is a gas giant composed mostly of hydrogen and helium, and has over 80 moons including Titan, which has a thick atmosphere and lakes of methane.

name: Uranus
description: Uranus is an ice giant with a pale blue color due to methane in its atmosphere. It rotates on its side, likely due to a massive collision in the past. Its atmosphere is made of hydrogen, helium, and icy compounds like water, ammonia, and methane.

name: Neptune
description: Neptune is the farthest known planet from the Sun. It is an ice giant with a dynamic atmosphere, featuring supersonic winds and dark storms. It has a deep blue color and 14 known moons, including Triton, which orbits in the opposite direction of the planet's rotation.
